item.title: CARGO DET AIR Indicating System (Main Deck/Lower Lobe)

remarks.para: Indication(s) for associated cargo areas may be inoperative provided associated smoke sampling system integrity is verified before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "CARGO DET AIR IND SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Verify integrity of smoke sampling system by one of the following two methods:

note.para: Refer to AMM 26-14-00/522 (Main Deck) and AMM 26-16-00/518 (Lower Lobe) for locations of smoke detection orifices.

numlitem.para: Provide pneumatic pressure in the center crossover duct (AMM 26-00-00/201).
Using a hot wire anemometer and adapter (AMM 26-16-00/508), verify at least 120 fpm velocity airflow through the appropriate smoke sampling orifices as listed below for associated status message(s):

entry.para: Forward-most orifice in fwd lower lobe cargo compartment smoke detection Zone 1 and aft-most orifice in fwd lower lobe cargo compartment detection Zone 4.
Forward-most orifice aft lower lobe cargo compartment smoke detection Zone 1 and aft-most orifice in aft lower lobe cargo compartment smoke detection Zone 4.
Forward-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 1 and aft-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 8.
Forward-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 9 and aft-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 16.

numlitem.para: Provide pneumatic pressure in the center crossover duct (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Using smoke from an available smoke generating source, accomplish the following for each orifice listed above (in Method 1) for the associated status message(s):
For the forward-most orifice apply smoke adjacent to the detection orifice.
Verify that the flight deck fire warning bell sounds off and the appropriate EICAS warning message displays.
After the flight deck fire warning bell has silenced and the appropriate EICAS warning message is no longer annunciated, apply smoke adjacent to the aft-most detection orifice.

Smoke sampling system integrity is verified provided the flight deck fire warning bell sounds off and the appropriate EICAS warning message displays for both the forward-most and the aft-most orifices as listed for the associated status message(s).
